subideas.content: CODE IS THE NATURAL LANGUAGE. Nor English, nor Spanish, nor any other language is "natural language" for software development. Code is the natural language for this endeavor.
If we define software development as problem solving by precise, testable, repeatable, and humanly reviewable, machine instructions, nothing is more natural than code.
Code is defined, structured, succinct, beautiful, expressive, and testable.
Why would we step down to a combination of English and unmastered ai generated code?

That's the reason why 70 years of software development lead to engineering marvels like C# or GO. This is the best way to solve problems with precision, observability, and reliable practices through software.
But let's move to another issue, preparing for the future...
Why would we want to develop without code if we still need to master code reviewing to be responsible professionals?
Would we say that AI generated code with no human review will power airplanes, financial systems, war machines and health care implementations?
We still have to understand all of it!
How are we going to do this if we don't master coding based software development?
Let me ask to the experts: How did you get to your status? By seeing code or by coding and coding and coding?
That's why I think that the future of the industry is standardization, testing, reviewing, and mainstream modern coding mastering.
AI can generate all the code we want, but we have to understand all of it, and to do so, we have to master software development trough code.
Maybe when the Vibe Coding hype discloses it's implications we'll see this more clearly.
We need a sea of senior developers to review the Tsunami of AI generated software that's coming.
